steps.title: Purchase rubber or plastic wheel covers for your suitcase.
steps.content: Purchase rubber or plastic wheel covers for your suitcase. While these do not protect the entire wheel, they offer additional support and will protect the wheels from most dings and scrapes. Basically, the wheel covers slip on over your existing wheels and screw into the bottom of your luggage. The top portion of the wheel is still exposed, while the back and sides are protected. Though these are difficult to find in stores, they are readily available from a number of online retailers.

steps.title: Buy an effective and stylish bag protector.
steps.content: Buy an effective and stylish bag protector. You can find these at any luggage shop and most department stores. Some of these cover the wheels, while others don’t. Make sure to check before purchasing. [2] X Research source Many protectors will have prints or vibrant colors to make your luggage stand out and easier to find at baggage claim. Protectors also carry the added bonus of keeping your whole bag free from dirt and scuff marks!

steps.title: Make your own luggage protector!
steps.content: Make your own luggage protector! If you have a large cloth laundry bag or canvas sack at home, you can use it as a luggage protector on your next trip. Simply place your luggage inside before getting to the check-in desk, close it up, and attach a tag to the outside to make it identifiable at pick-up. It may not be as stylish, but it will keep your wheels safe from most damage throughout your flight.

steps.title: Pack your luggage lightly and evenly.
steps.content: Pack your luggage lightly and evenly. To keep excess weight off the luggage wheels it is best not to overpack your suitcase and distribute the contents evenly. [3] X Research source Avoid packing heavy or awkward items in your suitcase. Many places such as gift shops will ship your items to your home so you don’t have to pack them for the journey home!

steps.title: Ship your bag to your destination when possible.
steps.content: Ship your bag to your destination when possible. Shipping your bags is not as expensive as you might think (and can be cheaper if you are paying to check your bags with the airline) and items are generally handled with more care. [4] X Research source Don’t forget to add insurance to your shipment and tell the clerk that the contents are fragile!

steps.title: Carry your luggage over rough surfaces.
steps.content: Carry your luggage over rough surfaces. Your wheels can take a beating on gravel, dirt, and potholes. If you lift your bag over these surfaces, you can extend the life of your luggage wheels.

steps.title: Find out if the wheels can be replaced.
steps.content: Find out if the wheels can be replaced. While replacing wheels on most luggage should be no problem, sometimes the design of the bag will not make removing the wheels possible. Take a look at your bag: most wheels will be able to be removed with a screwdriver or an allen wrench.

steps.title: Determine the kind of replacement wheels you need.
steps.content: Determine the kind of replacement wheels you need. The two basic types of wheels are recessed and spinners, each have many options in terms of inexpensive replacements. [5] X Research source In general, if you have two wheels they are recessed and if you have four wheels they are spinners. [6] X Research source The best kind of replacement wheels are made of polyurethane, a tough plastic used for skateboard and rollerblade wheels, which allows the wheels to roll over most surfaces without locking up or getting stuck in cracks. Be sure to measure your existing wheels and purchase the right size replacements. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Remove the old wheels from your luggage.
steps.content: Remove the old wheels from your luggage. It is a great idea to have a plastic bag or bowl handy for the screws and washers so they don’t get lost.

steps.title: Attach the new wheels carefully.
steps.content: Attach the new wheels carefully. Place the new wheel into the wheel slot and put the washers and screws back in place. Tighten the screws well and you are ready to roll!
